page.title: 08Pollution of the Brook
page.content: There has been a poison threat to the wildlife in this area. {"Irresponsible" farmers}have come under fire from a{Vale Conservation {Group}after hundreds of fish were killed by{river pollution}this week.Investigation by{F.O.E.}and the{ {Water Authority}have led to a poisonous herbicide known as{Dinoseb} being named as the likely cause of the pollution. The brook was a yellow green colour and as thick as pudding. Dinoseb is dangerous to humans, livestock and fish. The brook at Cropthorne where the fish were found runs from{Bredon Hill}into the{Avon.} The source of the pollution has been traced to a field upstream which has a public footpath running through it. This pollution has occurred on several occasions, and there is now a possibility of legal action.
